_exec_summary.SummaryText:
A. Accidental Release prevention and Emergency Response
Zirkle fruit company 's (ZFC) Prosser facility is a fruit packing and cold storage facility, located at 101 Benitz road, Prosser Washington in Benton County.

ZFC Prosser's accidental release prevention policy involves a unified approch that integrates technologies, procedures and management practices. It is the policy of this company to adhere to all federal and state and environmental regulations.


B DESCRIPTION OF FACILITY AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE
The Prosser, Washington processing facility stores, packs and ships fresh apples and cherries. This facilityemploys approximately 150 people. Activities are conducted at this site during all months of the year.

Anhydrous Ammonia is used on-site in a closed looped refrigeration system. Chemical properties of ammonie make it necessary to observe certain safety precautions in handling ammonia in order to:
* Prevent unnecessary human exposure
* Reduce any impact to the community and environment

C General Accidental Release Prevention program
Zirkle Fruit Co. Prosser's accidental releaseprevention program is based on the following key elements:

* Training of personnel
* Preventative maintenance
* Use of safety equipment
* Use of standard operating procedures

This facility complies with the following regulations and standards.

* OSHA and WISHA's process safety management rule
* Applicable Washington State and federal safety and environment regulations
* SARA title 3 tier two reporting
* EPA risk management plan 

The ammonia refrigeration system was installed to applicable standards and local codes at the time of instalation. Piping and equipment is secured and protected. Compressor (engine room) door are tight fitting, open the the outwards, and are locked when an operator is not present. Other safety systems utilized includes the following:
* Computerized contolls, which can be operated remotely thruogh pass code security.
* Suction trap hi-level floats
* High dis

charge pressure shut down
* Low suction pressure shut down
* High dicharge temperature shut down
* Oil pressure failure shut down
* High dicharge ampers unloading
* Automatic timer to prevent short cycleing (screw compressors only)
* Oil filters plugged shut down (screw compressors only)
* 250 psi relief valves on high pressure side, to prevent over pressure situations
* 150 psi relief valves on low pressure side, to prevent over pressure situations
* Ammonia detection and shut down in all cold rooms
* Ammonia detection and alarming in engine rooms with ventalation system activation.

Standard operating procedures have been prepared for the use of the employees performing operational functions. Procedures are kept in the refrigeration technicians office and on the ZFC network. These procedures include:
* Initial start-up procedures
* Normal shut down procedures
* Emergency shut down
* Consequence of deveation
* Routine operations
* Maintenance

A worse case and alternate (more likely) case release scenarios have been analyzed. The results considered in a toxic endpoint of 200-PPM offsite and included the most current census date for the population within the circle created from the release point to the 200-PPM endpoint.





FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There has been no accidental releases at the prosser, Washington Facility in the last five years from covered processes that resulted in death's, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite death's, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The facility has an emergency action plan that has been coordinated (reviewed) with the prosser fire department and benton county emergency services. Both are members of the local emergency planning committee.

The plan applies to all zirkle fruit employees, visitors, and suport service contractors performing tasks and activities as part of ongoing operations. The purpose of the plan is

to establish policies and procedures for protecting the health and safety of employees, contractors, and visitors, and to comply with all applicable federal and state regulations. The training of employees and contractors includes providing a copy of the plan upon initial employment with Zirkle Fruit facilities and reviewing it for their specific assignment, annual refresher training for current employees, and review for all whenever the plan is changed. In addition, plant evacuation drills are conducted on a regular basis.

The plan is comprehensive enough to deal with all types of emergencies specitic to the facility and defines the following:

How to conduct activities in a manner that protects the safety of employees, the public, and the environment.

Preferred means for reporting fires, hazardous materials incidents, medical, and any other emergencies.

Emergency escape procedures and emergency escape route assignments

Procedures to account for all employees including contractors and visitors.

Names of agencies and persons to contact for further assistance, information, or explanation of the plan

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

The Prosser, Washington facility takes seriously its responsibility for the safety of its employees, neighbors, and community. Central to this responsibility are our programs to prevent the release of chemicals to the environment. We will continue to implement these precautions and programs, to act as a responsible neighbor, and to maintain the goodwill of the community.
